channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DOJ brings charges in an alleged Iranian murder-for-hire plot against Trump
item.description: Federal prosecutors charged a man who said he had been tasked by a contact in Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard with planning the assassination of the Republican president-elect.
item.content:encoded:
Federal prosecutors charged a man who said he had been tasked by a contact in Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard with planning the assassination of the Republican president-elect.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: It's legal for police to use deception in interrogations. Advocates want that to end
item.description: Ten states have passed laws to ban the practice of lying to juveniles in custody during police interrogations. Now, one state wants to extend the ban to adults too.
item.content:encoded:
Ten states have passed laws to ban the practice of lying to juveniles in custody during police interrogations. Now, one state wants to extend the ban to adults too.

(Image credit: Denis Novikov)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Ballot measures to upend state election systems failed across the country
item.description: Statewide efforts to adopt open and nonpartisan primaries, as well as ranked choice voting, failed in this year’s election, delivering a stinging setback to the election reform movement.
item.content:encoded:
Statewide efforts to adopt open and nonpartisan primaries, as well as ranked choice voting, failed in this year’s election, delivering a stinging setback to the election reform movement.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: ESPN host Kirk Herbstreit's beloved game day-crashing dog, Ben, has died
item.description: Ben, Kirk Herbstreit's certified emotional support animal, had been diagnosed with cancer earlier this year. Audiences grew to love the 10-year-old golden retriever who appeared on TV with his owner.
item.content:encoded:
Ben, Kirk Herbstreit's certified emotional support animal, had been diagnosed with cancer earlier this year. Audiences grew to love the 10-year-old golden retriever who appeared on TV with his owner.

(Image credit: Michael Woods)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Boycott men? South Korea's 4B movement gains traction in the U.S. after Trump's win
item.description: After Trump's win, there are growing calls among American women to boycott men. They're drawing inspiration from 4B, a South Korean feminist movement that rejects dating, sex, marriage and childbirth.
item.content:encoded: After Trump's win, there are growing calls among American women to boycott men. They're drawing inspiration from 4B, a South Korean feminist movement that rejects dating, sex, marriage and childbirth.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Elwood Edwards, the voice of AOL's 'You've got mail' alert, dies at 74
item.description: Edwards recorded the iconic AOL lines at home with a cassette recorder for $200. Little did he know, he would become the voice that welcomed millions of people to the world of email.
item.content:encoded:
Edwards recorded the iconic AOL lines at home with a cassette recorder for $200. Little did he know, he would become the voice that welcomed millions of people to the world of email.

(Image credit: AOL Youtube)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Biden won big with young voters. This year, they swung toward Trump in a big way
item.description: Vice President Harris had hoped young voters would be a key part of a winning coalition. Instead, they shifted — sometimes by double digits — toward President-elect Trump, especially in swing states.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris had hoped young voters would be a key part of a winning coalition. Instead, they shifted — sometimes by double digits — toward President-elect Trump, especially in swing states.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Getting more light in the day and less at night is good for your health. Here's why
item.description: Diet, exercise and sleep are fundamental to our health, but so it our relationship to light. A massive, new study suggests light-driven disruption can take years off our lives.
item.content:encoded:
Diet, exercise and sleep are fundamental to our health, but so it our relationship to light. A massive, new study suggests light-driven disruption can take years off our lives.

(Image credit: Mar Lei)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Israeli soccer fans were attacked in Amsterdam
item.description: Soccer fans from Israel were attacked in Amsterdam in what the Dutch prime minister called "antisemitic attacks on Israeli citizens."
item.content:encoded:
Soccer fans from Israel were attacked in Amsterdam in what the Dutch prime minister called "antisemitic attacks on Israeli citizens."

(Image credit: InterVision)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: What Trump’s first days in office could be like. And, world leaders react to his win
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Susie Wiles as his White House chief of staff. And, here's a dive into what his first 100 days in office could look like based on his campaign promises.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Susie Wiles as his White House chief of staff. And, here's a dive into what his first 100 days in office could look like based on his campaign promises.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
